frame.name: Be_translation_equivalent
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Target_symbol</fen> in a <fen>Target_representation</fen> system is presented as equivalent to a <fen>Source_symbol</fen> in a <fen>Source_representation</fen> system in the ability to express a particular <fen>Content</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Target_symbol">The term employment area</fex> <t>translates</t> <fex name="Source_symbol">the French zone d'emploi</fex>.</ex> <ex>The term employment area <t>translates</t> <fex name="Source_representation">the French</fex> zone d'emploi.</ex>
<ex><fex name="Target_symbol">The term</fex> <t>translates</t> <fex name="Source_symbol">the Russian raznorechie (literally "different-speech-ness")</fex>.</ex> <ex>The term <t>translates</t> the <fex name="Source_representation">Russian</fex> raznorechie (literally "different-speech-ness".</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source_symbol
FE.definition:
<def-root>A symbol or set of symbols representing the <fen>Content</fen> in the <fen>Source_representation</fen> format.
<ex>This expression <t>translates</t> <fex name="Source_symbol">the Greek word Hades</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Source_representation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The representation system in which the <fen>Content</fen> pre-exists.
</def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>The period of time during which the translation equivalence holds. </def-root>

FE.name: Circumstances
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Circumstances</fen> are the set of conditions in which the translation is made.
</def-root>

FE.name: Target_symbol
FE.definition:
<def-root>A symbol or set of symbols representing the <fen>Content</fen> in the <fen>Target_representation</fen> format.
<ex><fex name="Target_symbol">The Tibetan sequence of words</fex> <t>translates</t> the Chinese Ti- shih.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Target_representation
FE.definition:
<def-root>The representation system within which the <fen>Target_symbol</fen> is equivalent in its signification to the <fen>Source_symbol</fen> within the <fen>Source_representation</fen> system .
</def-root>

FE.name: Content
FE.definition: <def-root>The information that is meant to be represented by the <fen>Source_symbol</fen> and <fen>Target_symbol</fen>. </def-root>

FE.name: Equivalence
FE.definition:
<def-root>An assessment of how equivalent the <fen>Source_representation</fen> and the <fen>Target_representation</fen> are.
<ex>Choose the Russian expression that <fex name="Equivalence">correctly</fex> <t>translates</t> the English word or phrase.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Medium
FE.definition:
<def-root>A text in which the <fen>Target_symbol</fen> is used to render the <fen>Content</fen> of a <fen>Source_symbol</fen>.
<ex><fex name="med">In the Greek Scriptures</fex> the word <t>translates</t> the Greek word "theos".</ex></def-root>

lexUnit.name: translate.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: be the translation equivalent of
